availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mildred J. Baker. Father of Hart Baker, Mary J. Baker, Henry Baker, Ada Baker, and Blake Baker. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 357. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 67. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 17. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Canton, p. 21. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registrations, 1863-1865, Ancestry, Kentucky, First Congressional District, Trigg County, 1863, p. 2.
